headline.main: 30 COUNTRIES SENT US GOLD LAST MONTH; Argentina $5,382,961, Germany $11,000,000, Japan $25,000,000, England $1,501,000.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Sept. 25.--Argentine banks for the first time in recent history have discarded sterling as the standard in international exchange operations and have adopted dollars as the basic currency.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Sept. 25.--Argentine banks for the first time in recent history have discarded sterling as the standard in international exchange operations and have adopted dollars as the basic currency.

headline.main: Adopt Dollars for Exchange.; Uruguay Clarifies Exchange Law.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Sept. 21.-Uruguay desires to make a commercial treaty with Cuba under which its chief export, jerked beef, can be imported here at a duty lower than the now prohibitive rate and is willing in exchange to purchase annually a minimum of 50,000...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Sept. 21.-Uruguay desires to make a commercial treaty with Cuba under which its chief export, jerked beef, can be imported here at a duty lower than the now prohibitive rate and is willing in exchange to purchase annually a minimum of 50,000 tons of crude sugar and increase its purchases of rum, alcohol and tobacco.
docs.abstract: Uruguay would export jerked beef to Cuba if tariff were lowered

headline.main: Uruguay Would Export Jerked Beef to Cuba And Buy More of Island if Tariff Is Lowered

byline.original: Special Correspondence, THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: URUGUAY EXPECTS ALVEAR.; Thinks He Will Reside There During Argentine Campaign.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26.-Better business in certain American export lines in the first half of 1931 is brought out in an analysis for that period made public today by the foreign commerce department of the Chamber of Commerce of the United States.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 26.-Better business in certain American export lines in the first half of 1931 is brought out in an analysis for that period made public today by the foreign commerce department of the Chamber of Commerce of the United States.

headline.main: EXPORT ADVANCE IN FARM PRODUCTS; Sixteen Items Showed Increase in First Six Months This Year Over 1930. CANADA WAS BEST MARKET Japan Displaced France as Our Fourth Best Customer--United Kingdom Second, Germany Third. Big Ten" in Export Trade. Import Decline by Countries.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Sept. 26.--The Chinese and Japanese delegations here remained passively on their positions today, awaiting, as did other members of the Council, the effects of yesterday's Council meeting on Nanking, and, above all, on Tokyo and Manchuria.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Sept. 26.--The Chinese and Japanese delegations here remained passively on their positions today, awaiting, as did other members of the Council, the effects of yesterday's Council meeting on Nanking, and, above all, on Tokyo and Manchuria.

headline.main: LEAGUE PUTS TRUST IN JAPANESE WORD; Council Waits in Hope Tokyo Will Withdraw Troops in Manchuria, as Promised. WIDE CRITICISM IS ROUSED Geneva Is Charged With Weakness and Blow to Hopes of Arms Reduction Is Seen. Seek to Pacify China. Discourages Arms Cuts.

byline.original: By CLARENCE K. STREET. Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Paraguayan Chamber of Commerce recommends that members cease importing from U S and Eur and buy from Argentina, Brazil and Uruguay
